name: Pope Sylvester II
summary: Sylvester II, born Gerbert of Aurillac, was Pope from 999 to 1003. He was one of the most learned men of his time, known for his knowledge of mathematics, astronomy, and philosophy. He was the first French pope and helped strengthen the relationship between the papacy and the Holy Roman Empire. He is credited with introducing Arabic numerals to Europe and was a key figure in the intellectual revival of the 10th century.
